dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I just puked like nine times. I’11 just throw it back up.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I can’t even swallow Advil! I have to mash it up and put it in Applesauce... that thing is huge.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Pretend it’s that homeless guy.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (fading) Dude. I didn’t know... Audrey musters the strength to lift Morgan’s head to the sink. She runs the water into Morgan’s mouth, putting the FLASH DRIVE IN. Morgan tries to swallow... but coughs it

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Lift your head back. Hold your nose. Morgan tries holding her nose and dangling the flash driv into her mouth. It goes in... and Morgan starts CHOKING. Audrey SLAPS her on the back. The flash drive flies out. Audrey, passing out, picks up the flash drive, thinking f THE DOOR flies open just AS THE TOILET FLUSHES. “Roger” i flanked by THREE THUGS. IN THE GIRLS’ POV, we FADE TO BLA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls come to -- finding their hands are CHAINED TO P above their heads. They’re in an old, rusted out locker r

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Audrey? They’re not alone. A MIDDLE AGED COUPLE sits by the SHOWE Audrey squints at them -- recognizes them -- gasps! IT’S DREW'S PARENTS. TOM and MARSHA are typical Midwester parents -- greying, thick, Patagonias. They look exhauste

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Tom! Marsha!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Who?  54.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Drew’s parents. (to Tom and Marsha) Oh God. Am I the reason you got dragged into this? Believe me, I never meant for of this to happen. I never meant for Drew to die...

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Help us get these off before they come back and chain you up too... Marsha nods sweetly, crosses slowly to Audrey and... PUNC HER HARD ACROSS THE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ahhhhhh! What the -- Marsha speaks... with a HEAVY RUSSIAN ACCENT.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Shut up, you dumb bitch.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Where’s the drive? He has an accent too. He approaches Morgan, pulling a KNI

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (realizing) You guys are in on this too.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Tell your friend to answer my fucking question.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Trust me. Your son would have wanted you to protect us.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Uh, Audrey. I don’t think those are really Drew’s parents.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yes they are! Right? (to Tom and Marsha) That dinner happened. We split the chicken lettuce wraps. We talked about Tom’s colonoscopy. We both love Scandal, Marsha! I was team Fitz, you were team Jake! Jake’s the good guy! Scott Foley!  55.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: I can like Scott Foley and be a Russian operative who is not Drew’s mother. Drew worked for us.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Where’s the fucking drive?! He holds the KNIFE to Audrey’s throat. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I... flushed it down the toilet. Silence. This is a big fucking deal.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Do you know what you’ve done? He glares at them. It’s a scary fucking look.

dialogues.speaker: TOM, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Nadedja! NADEDJA enters, now wearing a FORM-FITTING LEATHER SUIT.

dialogues.speaker: MARSHA
dialogues.text: Shoot these cunts in the head.

dialogues.speaker: TOM
dialogues.text: Torture them first. Make sure they’re not lying.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: We’re not! We have no reason to lie! We don’t even know what’s on that drive! No one ever told us! They leave the girls with Nadedja. She UNZIPS her CASE -- lays out a bunch of fucked up looking DENTAL EQUIPMENT. Audrey starts shaking. Morgan nervously starts rambling..

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You're really pretty. Like you’re barely human you’re so pretty --

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Morgan, shut up.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No! Everybody likes compliments! NADEDJA removes a pair of PLIERS. Approaches Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wow! Did you sharpen that yourself? Do you work with metal often?  56. Nadia brings the PLIERS closer.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God oh God oh God... Please no, stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fleet of BLACK SUVs races across the bleak countryside.

dialogues.speaker: I/E BLACK SUV
dialogues.text: Patel drives the lead car. Sebastian sits shotgun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long-abandoned, run down ICE HOCKEY RINK from the 70s. That’s where the girls are being held. On the ROOF -- the parents and some THUGS load gear into whirring HELICOPTER. ANGLE ON the DECAL on the chopper -- VOLVO. (Did you know Volvo made choppers? Apparently they for assassins posing as Midwestern parents)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nadedja nears Audrey’s mouth with the pliers...

dialogues.speaker: NADEDJA
dialogues.text: I ask question. If I don’t like answer, I take tooth. Same as her. A SOB. We reveal Morgan -- BLOOD is pouring from her mout

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: That was a fucking wisdom tooth! It was all the way up in there.

dialogues.speaker: NADEDJA
dialogues.text: Where is the drive?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I already told them. I flushed it down the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: NADEDJA
dialogues.text: I don’t like answer. She takes the PLIERS to one of Audrey’s FRONT TEETH.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: This is so bad for women! Nadedja brutally TWISTS AUDREY’S TOOTH. Audrey GASPS in p  57.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE SUVs pull up just in time to see the CHOPPER LEAVING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patel and Sebastian watch as the chopper retreats.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Fuck. They got the drive. (into a handset) Okay kids. On my order, scuttle the F-15s. Let’s blow this shithole up.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Wait. The girls could be in there.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: If they are, they’re either dead or surrounded by terrorists. Also: I don’t care.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Just give me five minutes and three agents. I want to check.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: So four agents can get killed? I can’t authorize that. And this is my operation.

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: F-15s are a minute out.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Sweet. Let’s crush this mother like we've crushed Yale in every football game since 2007. (beat) By “we” I mean Harvard. Sebastian makes a snap decision. He SLAMS PATEL’S HEAD IN THE STEERING WHEEL, knocking him out. Sebastian seizes hi RADIO. Does his best Patel impression:

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Actually guys, hold up? Abort mission.

dialogues.speaker: THE RADIO, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Go Crimson. He HANDCUFFS Patel to the steering wheel.  58.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian, HANDGUN up, creeps along the side of the build

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GUARD on the other side of the door with a RIFLE. Sebastian leaps out of nowhere -- KICKS HIM IN THE FACE - see his training in action. The Guard’s rifle CLANGS to t ground. Sebastian STOMPS on his fallen body. He’s out.

dialogues.speaker: THROUGH ANOTHER SET OF DOORS
dialogues.text: Sebastian peeks out -- moves quietly -- hiding under a BLEACHER. Takes in the cavernous HOCKEY RINK. Rats scuttle across DIRT where the ICE used to be. A MASS DECREPIT ZAMBONI in the corner. A moldy old HOCKEY GOAL. In the shadows, creepy THUGS stalk, on patrol. A muffled SCREAM from across the rink. Sebastian spots th locker room door on the far side. Knows they’re in there. FLICK! A RUSSIAN GUARD lights a cigarette inches from Sebastian -- doesn’t see him. He takes a drag, enjoying i He’d better - it’ll be his last ever. He walks a couple paces, around the ZAMBONI -- Sebastian’s waiting. In one fluid move, he has the guard headlock -- shoves the lit cigarette into his mouth -- ho it closed as the guard burns from the inside. Then crumpl Sebastian drops him -- runs swiftly, unseen, under the ri side barriers. Stops a few yards from the LOCKER ROOM... A CARD TABLE stands in the way. NINE BAD FUCKING GUYS aro it. All with guns on them. Eating, drinking, laughing. Sebastian silently checks his clip. He wouldn’t have enou bullets for all of them even if every shot was perfect. F

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blood is now streaming out of both the girls’ mouths. Nadedja smiles for the first time -- albeit sadistically as she pulls out JUMPER CABLES attached to a CAR BATTERY.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I’m telling you we don’t know anything!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I’ve never kept a secret in my life! I tell everyone everything!  59. Nadedja just hits the jumpers together. SPARKS fly.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I have herpes!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Proving to her that I’m honest and have nothing to hide! I stole my dad's painkillers from his hernia surgery and sold them at Coachella! Nadedja approaches Morgan with the jumpers...

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I text while I drive -- drunk -- all the time! I once made out with this guy who has a hormone disorder where he looks twelve. He’s actually forty, but still! It’s like I hooked up with a child!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Morgan. This is not helping--

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Tell her something personal about you.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Audrey has a recurring sex dream about Turtle from Entourage! Nadedja SHOCKS MORGAN. Morgan SCREAMS. Blinding pain.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BLACK SUV
dialogues.text: Patel stirs awake -- groggily realizes what happened. The realizes his hand is CUFFED.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: You fucking dick, Henshaw. Fuming, he reaches down with his free arm, manages to gra the WIRE to his mouthpiece. Talks into it.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Okay! Send the F-15s.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Drop the payload. Now. SEBASTIAN knows he has to move. Now.

dialogues.speaker: THE ZAMBONI
dialogues.text: Sebastian sits astride the beast. There’s no way this thi still works, right? No fucking way. But he has to try. He turns the IGNITION. It burps awake. Fucking miracle.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE CARD TABLE
dialogues.text: The thugs are confused. What the fuck is that? THE ZAMBON ROARS AHEAD -- NOW ON TOP OF THEM. SEBASTIAN drives. One moment the table was full of scary dudes. Now a THREE TON hunk of metal and giant spinning blades SHRED the life out of every one of them. Someone’s SEVERED HAND flies into the HOCKEY GOAL. Sebastian doesn’t have time to be impressed with himself GIANT MAN pulls him out of his seat. No actually, a straight up HULK -- pulls him to the groun Stands over him. This guy is the biggest monster Russia h ever created and he’s about to crush Sebastian. Sebastian KICKS. Gets him in the shin. This is nothing to him. Hulk leans down, takes Sebastian’s left arm. SNAPS I Blinding pain. Then Hulk SHOOTS him in the OTHER SHOULDER Sebastian writhes in agony as the thug points his gun at Sebastian’s head. So much for playing hero. He’s gonna di One last ditch thought -- Sebastian grabs for his gun. Wi two fucked up arms, he can’t AIM so he just SHOOTS WILDLY WHEREVER HE CAN. Hulk laughs. Bullets nowhere near him, b ONE BULLET ricochets around the rafters, hits a CHAIN. Wh holds -- AN ANCIENT SCOREBOARD. The scoreboard FALLS, rig on the Hulk. CRUSHES his SKULL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hearing the LOUD NOISE, Nadedja turns. What was that? A momentary reprieve for Morgan and Audrey as she grabs t guns and heads toward the noise...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian crouches under the bleachers as NADEDJA’S HIGH HEELS pass. Once she’s gone -- he crawls to the locker ro  61.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian enters and GASPS. Audrey and Morgan look horrible. But they’re alive. Seein him, they start collapsing in sobs -- but there’s no time

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: We have to move fast. Sebastian struggles to lift Audrey -- unhooks her from th pipe she hangs from. Not easy given his own injuries... Audrey unhooks Morgan. They hurry toward the BACK EXIT--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bloody, hobbled Audrey, Morgan and Sebastian hurry out the arena into the sunlight. The girls stop.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Where are we -- ?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Keep moving! Go! Go! The F-15s buzz over the ARENA. DROP THEIR PAYLOAD. Sebastian pulls them away as fast as he can as the buildi EXPLODES. A fiery boom. Then just a fire. The old rink is now a HEAP of RUBBLE along with everyone inside. At least they’re safe. Sebastian crouches over th girls, shielding them from the debris. As the smoke clear

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Okay. I trust you now.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, I should hope so. But when the smoke clears... there are FIFTY SPECIAL FORC AGENTS surrounding them. Guns drawn. Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian -- one arm bandaged, one in a SLING -- sits wit the girls in a holding room.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Be honest. Does this look fake? She smiles. An UNNATURALLY WHITE FAKE TOOTH where hers wa

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You know I would never lie to you.  62. Morgan leaves it at that. Audrey turns to Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I should have just given you the drive in the cafe. Then none of this would have happened.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t have believed me either. Drew told you to keep it safe.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Can you just tell us what is on that fucking drive?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I actually don’t know. What I know is it was made by an international terrorist group called Highland. Intelligence tells us they’re planning a series of assassinations. High profile people. The plans will be on that drive. So if we had it, we’d know how to stop them. Audrey is about to say something when -- THE DOOR OPENS. WENDY enters with PATEL -- his nose broke and bandaged.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Henshaw? My office. Patel, stay here. Sebastian glances back at the girls, then follows Wendy o In their wake, PATEL is alone with the girls. Awkwardly:

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What happened to your nose?

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Your new best friend slammed my head into a steering wheel so he could put our entire team at risk. In order to save you.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh. An awkward silence.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: So, “Patel.” Do you know a Danny Patel who went to Wesleyan?  63.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy coldly sits across from Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Henshaw, you read English at university. Did you ever learn the word “hierarchy”?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Wendy, I know I --

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: How about the word “treason”? That’s a good one. Love when it comes up in the crossword.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I know I overstepped --

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Overstepped? Overstepping is wearing a tank top on Casual Friday. Overstepping is stealing my Activia from the office fridge even though I brought it from home.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t steal your Activia.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Goddammit. We work for an international intelligence organization and I can't figure out who’s been eating my yogurt. My point is you did a lot more than overstep. You violated my direct orders, handcuffed your superior and went into a building swarming with terrorists without backup.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I know. I exercised poor judgment --

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Which one of them is it?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: The only reason I can fathom why you'd put the entire mission on the line to save two girls’ lives is you're in love with one of them. So which one is it? (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: WENDY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The one with the tooth or the one who invited me to see her in Pippin at the Santa Monica Playhouse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATEL paces the room, enjoying this. The girls are upset.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: So what was going through your mind exactly when you flushed it down the toilet? “This thing is so important that actual people are actually dying because of it. So I know what I’11 do! I’1l treat it like a piece of shit wrapped ina piece of toilet paper.” Morgan involuntarily LAUGHS. Claps a hand over her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: This is funny? Death is funny to you?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: No, just... that’s how you go to the bathroom? Audrey starts quietly laughing too.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Laugh. Meanwhile, I'11 tell you how many lives were lost and will be lost because of you.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: ...So let me get this straight. You take a piece of toilet paper and what? You like wrap your hands in it and then poop into it, and then take that whole contraption and that’s what you drop into the toilet? You know the toilet is designed to take all that work out of it for you? INT. CIA PARIS STATION. WENDY’S OFFICE - DAY Wendy and Sebastian, as before.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: How long did the doctor say it would take your arm to heal?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Two months for the bullet wound. Three for the fracture.  65.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Great. Take a five month leave.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I assume he meant the two arms will heal simultaneously.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: I know what I said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patel is in the middle of berating the girls. He leans in

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: And every time you hear the song that will be recorded by Sting (featuring Bruno Mars) about everyone who’s about to be killed, just know that that song would never have had to be made if you two weren’t such fuck-ups.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Okay. We get it.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Oh, sorry, have you had enough? (then) Drew was right about you. Audrey FLINCHES. Patel savors this.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're nothing to him. Just a place for him to put his stuff. Because no one would ever suspect you of anything. No one would ever think you were important enough. This hangs in the air for Audrey. The door opens and SEBASTIAN re-enters. Avoids Patel, addresses the girls.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I just wanted to say goodbye. You're on the next flight to LA.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What happens when we get there? Are we gonna go to jail?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No, we’ll take care of it. That’s what we do here.  66.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Actually Henshaw, not to be a grammarian here but you’re not technically included in “we” anymore when referring to what we do here. Since you’re suspended. Sebastian seethes but doesn’t say anything.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now how about you drop these two at the airport on your way home? Good practice for your next career driving a SuperShuttle.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. TOYOTA COROLLA
dialogues.text: Sebastian drives his modest car out of the parking garage Audrey sits shotgun, Morgan in the back.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Sorry about all the dog hair back there.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I’m surprised they don’t give you more of a badass James Bond car.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I don’t have company car privileges right now. Or for the next five months.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ugh. We ruined your life.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No you didn’t. I’1l be fine. And I don’t know what Patel said to you in there but this situation would be much worse if you hadn’t flushed that drive and it ended up in the wrong hands.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: But a lot of people are gonna die.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: And they would have died if you'd never found the drive in the first place. This is not your fault. A moment.  67.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Just out of curiosity, if we did still have the drive, what would have happened?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Well, hopefully we could de-encrypt it. Then ideally, we’d see what Highland’s plans are and stop them.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: How do you de-encrypt something?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Why do you want to know?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (a nervous beat) Because the drive is in my vagina.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yeah... Sebastian and Morgan are SHOCKED. Wait.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN MORGAN
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding?!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You told me it was important! I’m not going to flush something that important down the toilet!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: So it’s in there right now? Doesn’t that hurt?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You get used to it.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: So even when you were being tortured... you didn’t give it up. Sebastian is really impressed with Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: The ultimate irony would be if you saved the world, then died of Toxic Shock Syndrome.  68.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Right then, not to be impolite but do you think you might... access it? From... the place where--

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yeah. Everyone turn your head. ANGLE on AUDREY’S FACE as she unzips, removes the flash drive. A moment, then another ZIP. She holds out the driv

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Should I just put it...

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Uh, I’11 take that. An awkward -- and extremely intimate -- moment as Audrey hands the drive to Sebastian. He puts it on the dash, the turns off at an exit for CHARLES DE GAULLE AIRPORT.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Where are you going after this? Back to headquarters or whatever?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m sure they’1l un-suspend you if you show up with this.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Maybe. But I may try to take this one on myself.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: How? Look at you. You're like, disabled right now.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I'll figure something out. A moment. Audrey and Morgan exchange a look.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Dude, no. I’m not gonna sit on the plane watching Cake Boss while you're risking your life to clean up a mess we made. I want to help.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Me too. You can’t do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No. No. You two have risked your lives enough as it is. A moment. Then the other part of the truth comes out.  69.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: But... I don’t want to go back yet.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Me neither. This might sound stupid because this is your job and it's really serious and dangerous, but I feel like this is something we could actually be... good at.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I know. This is everything I love about theater and I’m finally getting to do it. Just pretending to be a spy.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: You're not pretending. Sebastian DOES AN AGGRESSIVE U-TURN. New plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A gorgeous historical library on the Seine facing the LOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Breathtaking details, centuries-old books. A tourist destination. But these are no ordinary tourists. The READING ROOM -- Sebastian inserts the FLASH DRIVE int his laptop while the girls look on. The same ENCRYPTED numbers and letters that appeared in the Apple Store pop

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Hmmmm. That’s odd. He LOOKS DOWN AT THE DRIVE. Then back at Audrey. Then bac the DRIVE. Audrey gets paranoid about what he’s judging.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Whatever dude. Not every woman is like, a waxed porn star. We have stuff going on in there.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No, no. I mean on the drive... this is State Department encryption.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Meaning?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Highland didn’t make this. Your government did. I can’t access it. I don’t have clearance. I’m suspended.  70.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: can’t you just hack the password? You're a spy.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: They change it every 24 hours. It’s 16 characters. Numbers, letters, case-sensitive. Even if I hada supercomputer, it would take days.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So... what are you saying?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: We can’t get into the flash drive. I’m saying we lost. A sober moment for all of them.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: There must be something else we can do.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Not unless you have access to some sort of expert on U.S. intelligence computer security. Morgan gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Actually, hold on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two FRENCH STUDENTS absorbed in MATH TEXTBOOKS. Around th the usual student technology -- laptops, mobiles, etc. Mo appears at their table. In her best French accent --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Ou est la bibliothéque? They students are confused.

dialogues.speaker: FRENCH STUDENT
dialogues.text: You're already at the library.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, sorry, it’s the only thing I remember from high school French. (then) I’m just gonna borrow this for one second. Be right back. She grabs one of their MOBILES and steps outside.  71.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back of someone’s head, staring out the window at the KREMLIN as he ties a TIE. His phone buzzes. He looks at t number, doesn’t recognize it, but answers it anyway.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: This is Edward.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Eddie? Eddie Snowden? Yes -- it’s EDWARD SNOWDEN.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’s Morgan. From Buck’s Rock Camp. Edward Snowden loses his shit.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Morgan! How are you? It’s been forever. I’ve sent you a bunch of emails over the years... I thought maybe you didn’t have your AOL account anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, I have a Gmail now.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: Actually... I knew that.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Right. I guess you would. (beat) So hey. I need a really big favor. A knock at Edward’s hotel room door. A RUSSIAN AIDE appea

dialogues.speaker: RUSSIAN AIDE
dialogues.text: Sir, Mr. Putin is ready for you.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: He can wait. (into phone) What do you need, Morgan? Anything.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Are you near a computer?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: Always.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the SITUATION ROOM, Wendy stares at the screens. Silen Then a CIA TECHNICIAN notices something on his computer.  72.

dialogues.speaker: CIA TECHNICIAN
dialogues.text: Ma’am! Ma’am. (Wendy looks over) They didn’t get on their flight.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Shit. She turns to PATEL. WENDY (CONT’D) Either those dum-dums took their selfie sticks to the Eiffel Tower or they lied about not having the drive and they’re on the run. Which agent took them to the airport? Patel freezes. He fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: I, uh, sent Henshaw.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: You sent the agent I just suspended for insubordination?

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: I'll fix it.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: You’d better. Give me an excuse to leave couples therapy early. I’m sick of watching my husband cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian types in the password Morgan reads off...

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: ...Two, upper case L, at sign, at sign, asterisk, lower-case j... ON THE SCREEN: A CHECK MARK. Sebastian and Audrey exchange a look, amazed. Sebastian hastily downloads the de-encryption key. He’s in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan is now trying desperately to wrap it up with Snowd

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Yeah. Totally. I love the Mighty Mighty Bosstones too. Makes sense that they’re touring Eastern Europe now... I’1l definitely try to make it. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But if I can’t, call me if you’re ever in LA!... Oh right, I guess I knew that. K then... bye. She hangs up on Edward Snowden. ON SEBASTIAN’S LAPTOP: ICONS flood the screen and don’t s There must be millions. Sebastian's eyes widen.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What? What’s on the drive.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: These... aren’t Highland’s plans. This is a lot bigger. Sebastian SLAMS THE LAPTOP SHUT just as Morgan returns. SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) We have to get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a lavish bed in a luxury hotel in Europe somewhere sit NADEDJA. She’s still alive? What the fuck? Her PROFILE, haunting beauty, lit by the sunset. She’s st faced, chain smoking, surrounded by artillery. EURO MTV p low in the background but she stares out the window. Her buzzes. She answers in CROATIAN.

dialogues.speaker: NADEDJA
dialogues.text: Zdravo. A VOICE speaks through a VOICE MODULATOR.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE MODULATOR
dialogues.text: I need to add another target.

dialogues.speaker: NADEDJA
dialogues.text: Double rate.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE MODULATOR
dialogues.text: No. You failed once. The girls are still alive. You should be happy we're still working with you. I’1l send you everything you need. We stay on NADEDJA as her A TEXT comes through. A picture SEBASTIAN. Then, LINK to GOOGLE MAPS with a MOVING DOT. Nadedja turns to assemble her weapons -- and we reveal -- HALF HER FACE IS MELTED OFF. Hideously deformed. The bomb at the ice rink. Well... she’s survived worse.  74.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the parked Corolla, Sebastian switches the SIM CARD in phone -- opens the TRUNK, pulls out DRY CLEANING.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Here. Change your clothes. We need to ditch anything they could use to find out where we’re going.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Where are we going?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Amsterdam. I know a place we can hide. As they all put on Sebastian’s DRESS SHIRTS...

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh my God my friend Beth lives in Amsterdam! She just emailed me about a new gallery show. (to Sebastian) She uses pipe cleaners and glitter to discuss draconian abortion access in contemporary India.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Interesting. Do you want your friend Beth to die?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I wasn’t saying we should go. (beat) Unless we get this all resolved and we're safe. Then I wouldn’t mind supporting her. Meanwhile, Audrey tries not to stare at Sebastian’s body she helps him button his shirt. Dude’s in great shape. He catches her looking. An awkward moment as they both redde There’s tension -- and not just the life and death kind. A series of QUICK CUTS, over energetic music -- -Morgan THROWS ALL THEIR CLOTHES into a DUMPSTER. -Sebastian pulls a stash of SPY SHIT -- MONEY, PASSPORTS, GUNS, GADGETS, A PACK OF CIGARETTES -- from his glove box -Sebastian walks Morgan through JIMMYING the lock on anot car, a modest PEUGEOT HATCHBACK. Then through hot-wiring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Peugeot zips out on to the road. Success.  75.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. A PARIS TRAIN
dialogues.text: NADEDJA in a CLOSED TRAIN CAR -- bad side facing away fro us, toward the window. She tracks the moving DOT. KNOCK KNOCK! A sleazy SPANISH GUY slides the door open.

dialogues.speaker: SPANISH GUY
dialogues.text: Good evening, beautiful. He sits next to her. Nadedja blithely turns, revealing th other side of her face -- now bandaged but SOAKED WITH BL SPANISH GUY (CONT’D) Bella, what happened to your face? Nadedja calmly lifts a hand and BASHES HIS NOSE IN. Amuse

dialogues.speaker: NADEDJA
dialogues.text: What happened to yours?

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SEBASTIAN'S CAR
dialogues.text: Sebastian and Audrey up front, Morgan sleeping in back.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So what kind of dog do you have?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Well, had.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh. I’m sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No. No. The dog’s still alive. He just lives with my ex.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Do you ever see him?... Or her? Or, sorry, maybe they’re both “him,” I don’t mean to be presumptuous.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: The dog’s a “he.” The ex is a “she.”

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Got it. What happened?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: You know. The usual. I worked too much. We never saw each other. She was having an emotional affair with one of her coworkers. They were always hugging. They once hugged for five minutes. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Just try to hug someone for five minutes. I bet you can’t.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yeah, that’s a really long time.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Also I found out she was selling weapons to the Chinese government.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Off the grid. I lost track of her -- and Banjo -- somewhere along the Kyrgyzstan border.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I’m really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Breakups suck. As you know. A moment of connection.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: They just make you feel crazy. Like, you're with someone for ten months, you think you’re in love... then you’re like, oh wait, that was all a lie. I was just a vagina for him to store a flash drive in.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: It’s more complicated than that. People reveal who they are in the end. It doesn’t mean what you had wasn’t real.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Morgan says Drew was always a selfish dick.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: And what do you think?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I mean, he did bring assassins to my apartment. But then again, so did you.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: (smiling) Shut up. In the back, MORGAN wakes up.  77.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Hey guys? I know we’re on the run from a shit-ton of people but can we eat soon? I’m fucking starving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over the gorgeous town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long, thin fingers type into a PHONE. “Targets located.” NADEDJA stands in a corporate office -- empty for the wee -- overlooking a quaint outdoor cafe. Through her SCOPE..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AUDREY, MORGAN and SEBASTIAN eat breakfast - in her CROSSHAIRS. We leave Nadedja’s POV and pull closer... revealing... It’s NOT THEM. It’s the AUSTRALIAN TOURIST GIRLS they sto passports from in Vienna. And some RANDOM SKEEVY GUY. One the girls wears SEBASTIAN’S JACKET FROM EARLIER.

dialogues.speaker: AUSSIE TOURIST 1
dialogues.text: How cute is this jacket?

dialogues.speaker: AUSSIE TOURIST 2
dialogues.text: I can’t believe you found it ina dumpster. You always find the best secondhand stuff.

dialogues.speaker: SKEEVY GUY
dialogues.text: Yeah, so, you guys into threesomes? BAM-BAM-BAM! All three collapse, instantly dead --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In an entirely different CAFE, our three heroes eat Dutch apple pancakes in peace. Totally safe. For now.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So Sebastian, is this what your job is like all the time?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Uh, no. Mostly it’s a lot of paperwork. Reading reports. Waiting to get sent into the field.  78.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: At least you have a field. My field is a conveyor belt with almond milk and cruelty-free chicken coming at me. Reeeeally slowly. With plenty of time for me to intercept them.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I’ve never had a job. But I love hearing about jobs. Maybe I should get a job here serving pannekoeken. I do a really good Dutch accent. Audrey knows.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: She played a guard in Diary of Anne Frank.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: The part was written as a man but at Oberlin we did a Gender-Switch version. On Sebastian -- what the fuck are they talking about?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Speaking of hiding out, where are we staying tonight? Do we finally get to sleep in a real hotel?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah, like one of those ones in Bond where there just happens to be a private waterfall for him to have sex under?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No. We need to stay somewhere we won’t stand out. Where we don’t seem weird. Because everyone there will be weirder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A grimy YOUTH HOSTEL. Full of freaks. A JAPANESE GUY play with a POSSUM. A SWISS GUY openly sells COCAINE. A THRUPL IRISH TOURISTS make out.

dialogues.speaker: AMSTERDAM, THE NETHERLANDS
dialogues.text: At the check-in desk, Sebastian hands cash to a clerk.  79.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian sits on one of the beds, on his laptop while Au looks on. Morgan, on another bed, channel-surfs on the ti TV. On the tiny DESK, an assortment of GUNS is laid out.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: ...So you’re telling me this drive gives us access to the entire Cloud? Everyone's private shit?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: The U.S. government has built a back door to access everything. Everyone’s private emails, their finances... everyone’s secrets. That’s what Drew stole.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What does Highland want with that?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Imagine the power that comes from unlimited information. Blackmail, theft, they can take anything. Know anything. This is why people are --

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Hey! You guys! On TV: CNN INTERNATIONAL NEWS. It’s a story about AMERICA GIRLS ARMED, DANGEROUS, AT LARGE. It’s Audrey and Morgan.

dialogues.speaker: CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR
dialogues.text: ...Thought to be part of a bigger terrorist plot, the young women were said to be involved in a hack at the Apple Store in Prague... The girls stare, mesmerized... CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR (CONT’D) .»..and the murder of a local doctor, which may have had a sexual motive.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Ew. We would not have sexual motives with that guy. That’s like, so insulting to us.

dialogues.speaker: CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR
dialogues.text: Here are recent photographs of the suspects... ON THE TV: Morgan’s photo is a glamorous headshot. Audrey is a drunken, shiny bar photo. Baggy, stained sweatshirt.  Sebastian 80.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Ugh, I keep trying to untag myself in that picture.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Was that from Halloween?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) It’s cute!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: It’s really not.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Sebastian, back me up here. Doesn’t Audrey look cute in that photo?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I’m busy.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What, you don’t have one second to validate her? All you have to do is give a thumbs up or thumbs down!

dialogues.speaker: CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR
dialogues.text: ...The FBI has released transcripts of Facebook messages between the suspects about victim Drew Thayer, confirming their intent.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh God. Morgan. Our chats...

dialogues.speaker: CNN INTERNATIONAL ANCHOR
dialogues.text: “I just wish he would die. Is that too much to ask? Just for someone to [expletive] murder him,” said Audrey Stockman. Then, “Do you want me to murder him? I totally will. That’s what friends are for. Music note emoji, music note emoji,” replied Morgan Freedman. finally looks up, amused.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Your name is Morgan Freedman?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: It’s Morgan Alexa Freedman on IMDB.  81.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh God. Morgan. Look. Onscreen - TESS BAKER-TONETTI: COLLEGE FRIEND OF SUSPECT.

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: ...-Honestly? I just don’t believe Audrey would ever do this. Audrey is surprised and weirdly touched. Until...

dialogues.speaker: TESS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: She’s just like, not that complicated of a thinker. I mean she’s 27 years old and she doesn’t even have a bed frame. Audrey shuts off the TV. She and Morgan cross to Sebastia

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: So with this drive, if anyone had ever emailed or like iMessaged a naked picture to someone else...

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: This drive could access it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Who did you send naked pictures to?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I can find out. He just said I can find out. Audrey grabs the LAPTOP. Morgan smacks her hands away.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Or we could look at pictures of someone we actually want to see naked. The girls exchange a knowing look. Beat. MORGAN (CONT’D) AUDREY Anderson Cooper. Amal Clooney. Morgan starts typing... Sebastian tries to wrestle the la back but she playfully holds it out of his reach.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Guys. This is not a joke... ONSCREEN -- A NAKED ANDERSON COOPER. Reverent silence.  82.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: God. Everything about that guy is chiseled.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Snow white carpet, snow white drapes.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Ooh, is that one from behind?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Anderson Cooper 360. Suddenly -- An ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER bursts into th room! ALL THREE OF THEM PANIC, SCRAMBLE FOR THEIR GUNS. Point i right at the backpacker... who is totally non-plussed.

dialogues.speaker: ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER
dialogues.text: (thick accent) Cool. He plops on one of the beds and immediately falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey enters the communal bathroom to find Sebastian unwrapping a KID’S travel toothbrush. She does the same.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What’d you get? I got the blond girl from Frozen.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: That’s Elsa. You can have my Olaf if you'd prefer. (off her look) I have nieces. (beat) Who are quite weirded out that I saw Frozen in the theater three times by myself. Audrey laughs. They switch toothbrushes, brush their teet SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) I hope you’re not upset about what that girl said. On the news.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I mean, I’m not surprised she said that. I haven’t really done anything that impressive with my life so far.  A moment. 83.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I’ve seen you do some pretty impressive things. You were a great shot in the cafe. You didn’t break when you were tortured. You had the forethought to put that thing up your... thing. You’re a natural at this.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You think so?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Well, I’m impressed with you too. Not a lot of people would've cared about saving me. Including my ex.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Audrey. About that. I want to clear something up. You weren’t just a cover for Drew. That much I know.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I was... there the night you two met. At your birthday last year.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You were at Barcade?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Outside. In the surveillance van. Drew was actually there to take out a target.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Who?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: The bartender. He was in ISIS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BARTENDER with a VERY LONG BEARD -- could be in Isis, c be in Iron & Wine -- hands DREW a drink at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: ISIS BARTENDER
dialogues.text: Craft Bourbon Cocktail with tobacco bitters and a rhubarb zest?  84. We hear Sebastian in V.O. through Drew’s earpiece.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Can you identify him as the target? Drew’s leans back to get a better view, knocking into Aud at the jukebox. He turns, sees her. Smiles. She’s cute.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: It’s okay. From DREW'S SIDE NOW, we see Audrey turn around in her TI

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Oh. Happy birthday.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What? (off tiara, deadpan) Oh, this? It’s not my birthday. I just wear this for warmth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian sits with TWO OTHER AGENTS, watching FOOTAGE of different areas of the bar. ONSCREEN, Drew and Audrey fli

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Thayer. We do not have time for this. (Drew ignores him) Thayer. Show me you’re listening to me. (Drew keeps ignoring him) Tell me this earptece is still working. Or I’m coming in there. They start dancing. Drew subtly NODS over Audrey’s should SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) If you see me, why aren’t you fucking moving?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MORGAN approaches the dancing couple.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Okay, kids. The birthday girl’s gonna turn into a pumpkin ina second. Let’s get Del Taco. Audrey and Drew break apart. Morgan addresses Drew.  85. MORGAN (CONT’D) You’re coming. You can bring your giant square chin with you.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No night is complete without a bad decision at Del Taco.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Actually... I can’t.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh. Okay. She’s disappointed. Drew glances back at ISIS BARTENDER, closing out the register. Preparing to leave...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I just, have a work thing.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: At 2am?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Yeah, my job is weird. This sounds like bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Okay, well, nice meeting you, Drew. She turns to leave. ON DREW -- glancing from the BARTENDE retreating to the BATHROOM and AUDREY on her way out...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Wait.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Don’t you dare give her your number. Do not give a witness at the bar where you’re about to murder a man your phone number.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: (sotto) Too Late. Audrey turns.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Too late for what?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Nothing. Here. Take my number. Maybe we can hang out another time.  86. Audrey lights up, hands him her phone. He punches in his number. Audrey leaves with Morgan. The second they’re gone, Drew SPRINTS TOWARD THE BATHROOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agents watch as onscreen, in the BATHROOM -- ISIS BARTENDER is finishing up at the urinal. Drew walks

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew, now steely-eyed, expertly moves toward him, grabs t back of his head -- shoves him hard right INTO THE FLUSHE HANDLE. We SMASH BACK TO --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey and Sebastian, as before. Audrey is overwhelmed.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: My point is, being with someone -- caring about them -- makes our job harder. So if Drew was trying with you... that was real.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Until I got him killed.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: He got himself killed. A moment. Sebastian tries to lighten the mood. SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) And not that you asked my opinion, but I would say the worst song on that jukebox is “Your Body is a Wonderland.” No question.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (laughing) No way dude! I lost my virginity to that song.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Wow. To who? The cheesiest person in the world?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh, I’m sorry. Did you lose your virginity in a non-cheesy way, Fancy British Guy? Now Sebastian’s laughing too. They’re enjoying each other Audrey turns to leave... then turns back.  87.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Why didn’t you let us die? Before.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I just thought you had value. We see this means a lot to Audrey. And clearly there’s a mutual attraction. Another charged moment between them... Until THE ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER bursts in.

dialogues.speaker: ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER
dialogues.text: Rookworst, am I right? He slams into a stall. The SOUNDS of a really large man having really an explosive shit. And the moment is gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian and Audrey are mid-conversation, laughing, as t walk back into the room.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: There are a_ lot of Jim Morrison posters in Amsterdam.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: God I hate the Doors. Fucking hate the Doors. They laugh. Then Sebastian suddenly stops. FREEZES.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Audrey. Audrey turns, GASPS-- Morgan is BOUND AND GAGGED in the m of the room -- strapped to a CHAIR -- tied to the DESK.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Morgan, what--—

dialogues.speaker: A VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: She talks too much. It’s PATEL. He emerges from behind the door -- GUN trained on them. Fuck. Sebastian acts lightning-quick, on instinct. He SWINGS at Patel with his unslinged arm -- but he’s injured, weakene Patel easily bats him away -- then shoves the muzzle of t PISTOL into Sebastian’s shoulder -- into his RAW BULLET H Sebastian SCREAMS in pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop! Please! Don’t! Stop it -- 88. Patel just pushes harder, harder. Sebastian WRITHES. Audr STEPS FORWARD to intervene, but he whips the gun back to

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Hands! Up. Both of you. (to Sebastian) That’s both hands, cripple. Audrey and Sebastian raise their arms. Sebastian winces - can’t raise his injured arm very high. Patel notices,

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Higher. Sebastian tries. It’s excruciating.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ...dust because I can.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: What is this, Patel? Revenge? I was already suspended. You won.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: I know I won. This isn’t about you. Or them. I’m just here for this. smirks. Patel moves to the desk -- reaches over a whimpering Morg slides the FLASH DRIVE from the computer.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Of course, now I have a couple of loose ends to tie up. He retrains the GUN on Sebastian, point blank...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Wait! None of this is his fault, okay? It’s mine. This was all me and Morgan. Just tell the CIA that.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Audrey, no... (to Patel) He’s not here on CIA business. He’s working for Highland.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Please. Highland works for me. And you won’t believe how much the Chinese Mafia is offering me for this thing. And the Russian Mafia. Multiple mafias.  89.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: So this is all about money?

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: Money, justice, whatever you want to call it. I personally think it’s unjust that I risk death every day and sacrifice any shred of a personal life to make sixty five grand a year and wear a suit from Men’s Wearhouse. And on that note, I’1l just finish you all and be on my way. As much fun as it’s been watching you kids play Tinker Tailor Stoner Spy. Patel waits for a reaction. Nothing. Audrey’s incredulous

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What, were you hoping to get a laugh? You’re about to kill us.

dialogues.speaker: PATEL
dialogues.text: I was on the Lampoon in college. Whatever. I’m funny. Doesn't matter. Cause one thing’s mightier than the pen and it’s called a fucking handgun. For heckling me, princess, you die first. Patel moves the gun to AUDREY’S TEMPLE... hand on the trigger... SQUEEZING. SQUEEZING. A tense final second, AN Patel GASPS and DROPS to the ground, DEAD! The ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER stands behind him. He leans down, pull his BLOODY KNIFE from Patel’s back.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Jesus!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh my God. Shell-shocked, Audrey rushes to Morgan and UNPEELS the ta They hug, both messes of emotion.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Thank you. Oh my God, thank you.

dialogues.speaker: ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER
dialogues.text: This man was robbing us, yes?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER
dialogues.text: He might have stolen Angelika.  90. He unzips his backpack. A GIANT YELLOW SNAKE SLITHERS OUT ENORMOUS FINNISH BACKPACKER (CONT’D) Just ignore her. She’1ll take herself for a walk. He climbs back into his bed, puts the knife down on the s closes his eyes. The snake slithers over Patel’s dead bod Everyone is a little disgusted. But they don’t dare compl after what he just did for them. Morgan turns to Sebastia

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: So what now?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: First, we have to move this body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan and Audrey carry a blanket-wrapped SOMETHING -- it clearly a body -- through the lobby. Sebastian in tow. Th are just a couple of people there. They’re all suspicious

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Just act like everything we’re doing is normal and no one will question it. People only suspect you when you look like you’re trying to hide something. Smile. Make eye contact. Say hi. Morgan and Audrey take the note too far, smiling and sayi hello to EVERY PERSON they pass. A SLEAZY GUY by the desk smiles back at Morgan. Gives her a little nod - ‘Sup girl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian hot-wires a BLACK SEDAN as Audrey and Morgan ea Patel’s body into the trunk.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We need a clean car. Then we need to get out of the city.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. BLACK SEDAN
dialogues.text: Audrey drives. Sebastian’s shotgun. Morgan in the back.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: How did he find us?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: We took every precaution. We used cash. No phones --  91. Then Audrey realizes something. Turns back to Morgan. Mor quickly looks out the window. Audrey realizes.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Morgan, did you call your parents?!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry! I just had to tell them I was okay! I thought maybe my dad found out about Roger and I didn’t want them to think I was dead so I got a burner phone at the gift shop and just said hey I’m fine -- real fast -- then I threw it ina dumpster! Like on The Wire! I thought you couldn’t track a call if it was less than two minutes!

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: That’s not a thing anymore.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I realize that now.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Morgan. Listen to me. You cannot do any more shit like that. You put all of our lives in jeopardy.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I’m sorry! But it’s not like I’m the only one of us who fucked up.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Who else fucked up?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: You left the drive in the computer?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Just for a second! You were in the room! Where else would I put it?!

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with your ass?!

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: My ass? I couldn’t have done that with my arm like this! I wouldn’t have been able to get the angle.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You could have asked one of us to help you insert it. I was in the bathroom with you.  92.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. I’m sure Audrey would have loved to put something up your ass! I’m sure she still would.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (reddening) Not in a sexual way. Just like, for the sake of mankind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An abandoned industrial area by the waterfront under the cover of night. The girls fill Patel’s pockets with ROCKS The girls lower Patel into the water. As body slowly sink CELL PHONE BUZZES. PATEL’s. It’s coming from under the blanket. It’s on him. The girls freeze, set the body down

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: We need to check who he’s texting. Audrey takes a breath, and wades into the water. His dead face stares back at her. She winces, reaches into his jac removes the phone before it gets wet. Slides to unlock it

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: The phone needs his thumbprint.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Well... there’s his thumb. Audrey grabs Patel’s dead arm. She presses thumb to butto The phone unlocks. There’s a TEXT from an unknown number: “Text me when you get the package.”

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What do I say back? Who is he texting with?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Let’s find out. Tell them we have it and ask them where the drop is. She writes back. A moment, then another BUZZ. “Bring it to Operation Albrecht.”

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What’s “Operation Albrecht”?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Let’s check his emails.  93. Sebastian pulls the DRIVE and laptop from his bag. Insert the drive, kneels on the dirty ground, laptop on his knee ONSCREEN -- PATEL’S EMAILS. He searches “Albrecht.” SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) He’s been emailing with someone named “Hunter Pierce.”

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Okay, so, a gay porn star.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: “Operation Albrecht” appears to be Highland’s first planned assassination. They don’t name the target, but it’s going down tomorrow night. There’s a gala at the Museum of German Technology in Berlin. Text back and tell him you'll be there with the drive.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Shit. It locked again. Audrey uses Patel’s thumb again, replies. Meanwhile--

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Wow, Patel has a lot of pictures of his mom on here. ON THE SCREEN -- Photos of PATEL and an OLDER WOMAN. where they’re BOTH NAKED AND MAKING OUT.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Ahh. Not his mom! Not his mom!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Wait! (urgent) That person’s gonna keeps texting. We'll need his thumb. Then one They all exchange looks. is already in the water. shore and SMASHES IT on returns the cold water, CLOSE on his hand as it There’s just one option and Audrey She grabs a BEER BOTTLE from the a rock. Holding the JAGGED GLASS, she over to Patel’s body, nearly under. sinks. Audrey grabs it -- uses the glass as a BLADE, CUTS PATEL’S THUMB OFF. Not much blood. She holds up the thumb to her cohorts in victory. It’s disgusting, but we see Audrey is also weirdly proud of herself. She really is a natural at this.  94.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sun rises over Berlin.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Here’s the plan. The guest list for the gala includes the Canadian ambassador and his wife. Audrey, you and I will pose as them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Passengers deplane, hug family, pick up their bags.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Won’t people know what they look like?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No. No one ever remembers what Canadians look like... They land at Tegel Airport at 2pm. At BAGGAGE CLAIM -- a GENERICALLY HANDSOME MAN and his PL BLOND WIFE walk briskly towards... A SIGN with their NAME it: “AMBASSADOR AND MRS. MULLICAY.” Pan up-- The DRIVER HOLDING IT is MORGAN. In a hat and everything.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Can I do an accent?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You don’t need to.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nah, I’m gonna do an accent. I know what I’m gonna do. “To really inhabit a character, you must speak with their tongue.” Stanislavsky. She takes the couple’s carry-ons. In a THICK COCKNEY ACCE

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: ‘ELLO. Funny coincidence -- you two is from London, Ontario and me, I’m from Jolly Old London! England. The Canadians are taken aback.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan leads them to a LIMO in a corner of the EMPTY roof wasn’t necessary to park this far. The Canadians exchange glances but don’t say anything because they’re Canadian.  95.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan turns on the engine and opens the sunroof... AUDREY -- suddenly on TOP OF THE CAR -- sticks her head d into it! The Canadians SCREAM. Morgan feigns SHOCK too.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh my! Rascal! Ruffian! Begone! Audrey shoots the couple with TRANQ DARTS. They pass out.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Have a nice nap, guys. Sorry you'll miss the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A dingy public bathroom. Audrey DYES HER HAIR BLOND in th sink to MATCH THE CANADIAN WOMAN’S. Morgan dyes her hair

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Do I look like her?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Yeah. Do I look awesome?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You look cute.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I just feel like for our friendship, we should be changing our looks at the same time. You to a Canadian Ambassador’s wife and me to a young Julianne Moore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A stunning modern glass-walled building with a GOLDEN PLA on top. Fancy couples walk up a RED CARPET to the GRAND ENTRANCE, manned by SECURITY. From behind, we follow a MAN in a TUXEDO, and a BLOND WOM in a RED SATIN DRESS and HEELS. We move around them... It Sebastian and Audrey. They look amazing. Throughout this sequence, Sebastian, Audrey and Morgan will be able to he each other on earpieces.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Morgan, are you in position?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan is dressed in a LAVENDER UNITARD. Acrobats in matc unitards stretch and warm up. Morgan stretches with them.  96.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I was born in position.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Everyone was born in position. That’s why they call it “the fetal position.”

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh, I just put that together. But yes. I’m psyched about this. Performing with Cirque de Soleil is like, a top three dream. I was a Cc.I.T. in Acrobatics and Clowning at camp. It was competitive.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Once again, Morgan, you are not performing with the troupe. Your job is to stay backstage and watch the surveillance. We have to locate the assassin.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What about just for one song?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: No. Morgan longingly eyes a LITHE MAN doing a warm-up back fl

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: This is like taking a thoroughbred to the Kentucky Derby and telling him, “you have to stand here and watch the Kentucky Derby, Horse.” Sebastian addresses the Marines in a PERFECT CANADIAN ACC

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Evening! Honey, you have our passports? Audrey proffers the Canadians’ passports. The Marine surv them. Looks back to Sebastian and Audrey. A tense moment. Then he waves them through. As they enter the party...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: That was a perfect Canadian accent.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I watch a lot of Degrassi.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Really?!  97.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: (dumb bro accent) Naw -- it’s my training, dumbass. (then) That was my LA accent.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Shut it.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: You look good as a blond, by the way. And are you wearing lipstick? Hearing this, MORGAN smiles as she mans --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- a bank of SECURITY SCREENS. Guests move around the par

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: What am I watching for exactly?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anyone you’ve seen before. Or anyone who looks suspicious. But Morgan can’t help but glance longingly at the unitard clad Cirque de Soleil performers as they frolic past the curtains to a STAGE set up in the ATRIUM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vast room of German TRAIN CARS from various eras. Sebas and Audrey hold hands as they move through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What constitutes suspicious?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Use your instincts.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I have great instincts. If I’m attracted to them, they’re probably gonna get us killed.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: (deadpan) So, that guy might kill us? Sebastian points to a cheesy BRAZILIAN DIPLOMAT with a ponytail, in a white tux.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Actually, my high school boyfriend Craig looked like that. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Interests included: Family Guy and finger-banging. Usually at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: My girlfriend at Uni kinda looked like her. He points to a TINY VIETNAMESE WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I had that phase in college too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan’s eyes widen, seeing someone head towards the stag

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Hey. I see someone very suspicious.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Stay calm. Describe him. REVEAL the man Morgan was talking about as she describes

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: He has a long twirly mustache. Big pointy scary eyebrows. He’s holding... yeah, he’s holding a bag with a big dollar sign on it. Sebastian and Audrey glance at the stage. The MUSTACHE MA clearly the bad guy in the Cirque de Soleil show.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I think that guy’s part of the show.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yeah, I don’t know that an actual bad guy would look like an evil Mr. Monopoly.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I’m gonna go with my gut on this. Morgan joins the acrobats heading for the stage. She keep her eyes on Mustache Man as she climbs THE TRAPEZE. The man is miming and twirling his mustache. As Morgan gets to the top... he opens his DOLLAR SIGN BAG CONFETTI pours out on to the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. You know what? I think you might be right.  99. AUDREY notices a COUPLE across the room. She grabs Sebast

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh my God.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Tom and Marsha. Or whatever the fuck their names are. Drew’s fake parents. They’re the assassins. Sure enough, “Tom and “Marsha” -- also dressed FORMALLY, blending in -- stand at the bar. Glam outfits. Finally looking like the chameleonic agents they really are. "Marsha” spots them. She taps “Tom.” The couples stare at each other for an intense moment across the room... Just group of people passes between them. When the sea opens up again, “Tom” and “Marsha” are gone.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Morgan, get down. I’ve been blown. Morgan LAUGHS. SEBASTIAN (CONT’D) This isn’t funny.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh God, I know. I know. (beat) But you just said “I’ve been blown.” She laughs again. Sebastian shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Okay, both of you. Stay together and in plain sight until I get back. (then, to Audrey) You put the drive somewhere safe?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yes. Very safe.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Is it in... the same place as last time?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You’1l have to find out. She flinches. That came out way too forward. Audrey stamm  100.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, not “you'll see” as in... I just meant I’11 tell you later... Whatever, just go! As Sebastian hurries off, also blushing a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan turns to descend the ladder when she sees someone across the way, on the opposite acrobat landing. NADEDJA. Face bandaged but wearing a unitard like it was for her. Morgan mutters to herself:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Oh my God. That girl. A MALE ACROBAT behind her pipes up, also staring at Naded

dialogues.speaker: MALE ACROBAT
dialogues.text: I know. Butterface, right? Nadedja sees them. Morgan grabs the trapeze. It’s going d

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian hurries to the edge of the ballroom -- a big DO into a BACK HALLWAY... manned by a SECURITY GUARD. Sebast thinks fast -- pretends not to see the guard as he pulls pack of CIGARETTES from his jacket, tries to hurry past.

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Rauchen verboten! No smoking! Sir! But Sebastian’s on the other side of him now. He plays DU steps back. The guard follows. Now they’re behind the doo

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Sorry. Filthy habit, I know. (conspiratorially) Want one?

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Sir, I don’t smoke.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Me neither. Me neither. Sebastian TOUCHES THE UNLIT CIGARETTE to the guard’s neck BZZZZZT. It’s a TASER. The guard attempts to GRAB SEBASTI as he falls... knocking out Sebastian’s EAR PIECE.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shit.  101. He scans the floor but can’t find it in the shadowy darkn Fuck it. He has to move. Sebastian hurries down the hallw

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back in the crowded ballroom. Audrey stands alone in the CROWD. PATEL’S PHONE VIBRATES in her hand. A new text: “In position. Where are you?”

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Sebastian? They just texted me... Sebastian? Silence. Audrey starts to get nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sebastian enters a dark room full of imposing GERMAN PLAN He looks around. No one in sight. THUNK! A PROPELLER comes out of nowhere and KNOCKS HIM fr behind. Sebastian collapses, passed out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey stares at the phone. Still no response. Tries agai

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Sebastian, what’s going on? Audrey inhales. She’s gonna have to do this herself. She subtly reaches into her bag and pulls out her TUBE OF LIPSTICK. Takes the cap off... twists it. PATEL’S THUMB SPIRALS UP. Audrey shudders a little as she uses it unlock the phone. Sends a text. She texts: “I don’t see you” She gets another text: “Ships Room” Audrey takes a deep breath. As she crosses to the EXIT, s STUMBLES over the FALLEN GUARD. Beside him, Sebastian’s “CIGARETTES.” Audrey picks them up, hurries down the hall PRE-LAP loud CHEERING...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CROWD GOES WILD as “Butterface” guy does an impressiv back-flip. On the landing... CLOSE ON MORGAN. She’s next. Morgan’s entire life has been building to this moment. Mo jumps from the landing, SWINGING a HUNDRED FEET IN THE AI  102. NADEDJA does the same, swinging from the other side. CRAS The women meet in the middle. NADEDJA deals the first blow -- KICKING MORGAN in the stomach. Morgan SWINGS BACK, sticks her FEET OUT, CAREENS back into Nadedja. Knocks her back. The crowd CHEERS, unaware this is for real. Loving it. Despite that it’s life or death, Morgan is exhilarated to

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey enters a ROOM of CENTURIES-OLD SHIPS. She steps to middle of room. Silence. Then -- She sees a SHADOW moving Audrey freezes. The figure keeps moving toward her. And finally emerges into the light... IT’S DREW. HOLY SHIT. IT’S FUCKING DREW!

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: What the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Audrey! He seems overjoyed to see her. Audrey’s mind is blown.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So wait, you’re not... ?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Dead? Yeah. That was a surprise to me too, after what happened.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: But I_saw you get shot. You were bleeding. You were dead. I thought. You weren’t dead?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I was right on the edge. But the bullets missed my vital organs. I woke up in a military hospital.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: But on the news... Morgan and I are like, wanted for your murder.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: You're not. That’s how the CIA’s been trying to find you. They lie. But they don’t want to hurt you. They're trying to keep you alive. That’s why I’m here. To save you. (beat) And stop Henshaw.  103.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Sebastian? He’s been helping us.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Audrey, have you heard of Highland?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: That’s who Sebastian’s working for. He’s the assassin.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So who’s the target?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Me. I am. He’s been using you to get to me. And it worked.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (wait? what?) That doesn’t make sense. Sebastian knows I thought you were dead. And I saw Patel try to kill him. And Patel admitted he worked with Highland. And I’ve been texting with the assassin with Sebastian right next to me, so how --

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Hey. Can we like, stop with the questions for a second? I’m just... I almost died a few days ago. I thought I would never see you again. Can I just give you a hug? But when he steps toward her, Audrey reflexively steps ba

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Audrey...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Sorry. I’m just on edge. People have been trying to kill me all week. I know that’s like, all in a day’s work for you but I work at Trader Joe's...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: You must have been so scared. Ugh, the thought of anyone trying to hurt you... Audrey flinches. This triggers something for her.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You hurt me, Drew. A lot.  104.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I know I did. And I’m so sorry...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You lied to me about everything. You let me think I was meeting your parents and they weren’t your parents.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: They’re the people I’ve been hiding from. When they found me in LA, I knew my cover was blown. And it was just easier to... make something up... I knew if I told you the truth, it would lead to questions I couldn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Is that why you broke up with me by text message? Because it was too hard to tell me the truth? You said you loved me. Was that a lie too?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: No! I did love you. I do love you. Even more now that we can finally be honest with each other. This is everything Audrey was waiting for. Especially whe

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (playful) Audrey Stockman, I love you as much as I hate that fucking Crash Test Dummies song. Audrey smiles. Letting her guard down a little. Playing b

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Which Crash Test Dummies song are you referring to, Drew? Cause there are so many. I don’t remember any one in particular.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No really, I’m gonna need you to jog my memory. Cause I have all their albums and there are just, a lot of tracks. And bonus tracks.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I hate you. I know I just said I love you but I also hate you.  105.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: If you could maybe just sing a couple bars. How does it go? Drew shakes his head. He knows what he has to do. And the in a deep bass-baritone, Drew starts SERENADING AUDREY.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Once, there was this girl who... Off Audrey -- a captive audience in spite of herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
