dialogues.text: Morgan struggles to hang on to the TRAPEZE with one hand NADEDJA swings across... SLAMS both her feet into the arm that’s holding on. Morgan’s FINGERS slip... but she regai her balance, tightens her fist. Reaches up with the other hand, steadies herself, swings back towards waiting Naded Morgan KICKS Nadedja at full force. It just makes Nadedja mad. From behind her unitard, Nadedja PULLS a GUN. The cr keeps cheering. Assuming it’s part of the show. Until... Nadedja FIRES -- Morgan LETS GO OF THE TRAPEZE -- sails through the air, j missing the BULLET. It HITS an ACROBAT on the far platfor The Acrobat falls backward, DEAD. He hits the floor, at t crowd's feet. SLAM. The crowd is stunned. As they realize what’s really going on-- MORGAN SAILS onto NADEDJA’S TRAPEZE... landing on top of Nadedja -- her legs wrapped around Nadedja’s NECK. NADEDJA TIPS backwards under the weight... just as MORGAN manages to GRAB the TRAPEZE by the tips of her fingers. Nadedja flails, tries to get a grip. But Morgan blocks he NADEDJA FALLS, FALLS, FALLS -- SLAM. She hits the FLOOR f a hundred feet, at the crowd’s feet. People are now fully SCREAMING. NADEDJA is finally DEAD. Morgan SWINGS safely above, watching from her perch. Catc her breath. Holy fucking shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drew is now standing close to Audrey. Leaning against an ship just like they leaned against that jukebox at Barcad  106.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: ...When I woke up in that hospital and I didn’t know where you were, or if you were even alive...

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I know. I know. When that guy shot you... it was so fucking horrible. Audrey chokes back tears a little. The adrenaline she’s b running on for days giving way to the raw emotion she’d tamped down. She tries to fight it but Drew’s not blind.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Hey. Kiddo. The term of endearment just makes Audrey more emotional. puts his arm around her and holds her close. Audrey tentatively lets him. In his arms, she relaxes. She’s bee wanting this for months. They embrace for a moment. Then.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ooh, what’s this? Drew pulls the TASER CIGARETTES sticking out of her purse

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You got some spy gadgets?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: What else you got here, Jane Bond? He tosses the cigarettes aside and gently takes Audrey’s off her shoulder. Starts rifling through.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When’d you start wearing lipstick?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Uh, I wouldn’t open that. He does anyway. Finds Patel’s THUMB.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Wow. A thousand guesses and I never would have landed on thumb. Audrey laughs as Drew returns to the purse. Rifles quicke now -- less playful. Audrey gets a weird feeling.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Hey. The drive isn’t in there.  107.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: What? No! Audrey... He stops rummaging. Puts a hand on Audrey’s shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (too fast, less genuine) We're in this together! We just have to get out of here. Trust me. We can go anywhere you want. You pick. China? You love Chinese food. Can you imagine what they can do with a breakfast burrito over there with those moo shu pancakes?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You said not to trust anyone. They lock eyes for a second.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Touché. Then the DOOR OPENS. “TOM” and “MARSHA” drag in a CUFFED, GROGGY SEBASTIAN.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Sebastian... Audrey rushes toward him.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Audrey. He’s with them. “MARSHA" Oh look! We’re all together again. Just like the Cheesecake Factory.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Fuck, you hit me hard. I’m hallucinating.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: No, it’s Drew. He’s still alive.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Audrey... get away from him. Now. He’s gonna kill all of us.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Funny, he just said the same thing about you. We can see Audrey really doesn’t know who to trust.  108.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan rushes down the hall, frantically looking for Sebastian and Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others, as before. “Tom” turns to Drew impatiently. “TOM” All right, Thayer, we gave hima full check. Drive’s not on him. Can we remove the target now?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (to Drew) Wait, you said you were the target. You said you’re Operation Albrecht. “Marsha” points her gun at Audrey’s head. Audrey is TERRIFIED. Then DREW pulls out a GUN as well... Audrey screams... But he doesn’t shoot her. He SHOOTS MARSHA. BA “TOM” LUNGES for the door but Drew gets him too. BAM. “To falls back, on to an ANCIENT ANCHOR. It IMPALES HIS HEAD. Brain matter everywhere. Audrey shakes, tries not to wret

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh my god...

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: It’s okay, Audrey. I’m right here. No one else matters right now. He turns the gun on SEBASTIAN.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Drew, don’t!

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: (calmly) Audrey, listen to me. Drew has been working with Patel.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Sebastian was working with Patel.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Audrey, you saw Patel try to kill me yesterday. He’s the one who sent that assassin after you in Belgium. Drew was gonna let that happen. He would have let you die.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Sebastian sent the assassin to Belgium.  109.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Okay. Everything I say you did, you can’t just say I did.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I can do whatever I want! I’m the one with the gun. He turns to Audrey. Meanwhile, Audrey notices MORGAN slip into the room. No one else sees her... Morgan spots DREW. SHOCKING. But she stops herself from making any noise. Th girls share a meaningful look. Morgan tiptoes into the SHIP beside Drew.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That night we met... changed my life. I was driving by that bar and I saw you. Walking. And I was like, wherever that girl’s going, that’s where I want to be.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: So that’s why you went into Barcade? Because you saw me?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: I would have followed you anywhere. There was just something magnetic. I know this is cheesy but it felt like Kismet. It felt like fate.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Really? Cause I thought we were being totally honest with each other. You went to Barcade to assassinate the bartender. And suddenly, Audrey puts it all together.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Wait. Hunter Pierce, from those emails. That was Ryan Phillippe’s character in that terrible “Marked Target” movie you made me watch. And “Albrecht”. That’s Theo Albrecht. Founder of Trader Joe’s. You came here to assassinate... me. SIRENS approach outside. Drew SNAPS.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Oh my God, I forgot how fucking annoying you are. Fuck this shit. Drew SHOOTS SEBASTIAN, who falls backwards. Audrey tries move to him but Drew is now pointing the gun at her.  110.

dialogues.speaker: DREW, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where’s the fucking drive?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I'll tell you, okay? But there’s one thing you need to know first. Morgan likes to set things on fire.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Morgan likes to set things on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morgan crouches behind a SMALL SHIP’S CANNON, aiming it a Drew. She uses the CIGARETTE TASER he tossed aside to LIG THE FUSE. Amazingly, it WORKS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CANNONBALL sails from the ANCIENT CANNON across the roo NOWHERE NEAR DREW. It arcs through the air -- CRASHES thr the glass window. SMASH! It lands on a parked car outside CAR ALARM sounds. Bystanders yell -- what the fuck? Drew turns to Audrey, his charming smile now condescendin

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Nice shot. Great plan, Audrey. He aims his gun at Audrey’s head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Panicking, she picks up a SOFTBALL-SIZED CANNONBALL -- he as hell. But she flings it with every bit of her strength

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CANNONBALL CONKS Drew on the head. HARD. He weaves. H falls. He drops his gun -- Audrey scrambles for the gun. As does Drew. As she gets closer he reaches for her leg. She FALLS. Drew pulls her Audrey reaches and stretches for the gun. She kicks -- ge him a few times in the face -- but Drew holds on. She... GRABS it just as -- Drew gets up and LEAPS on top her. They struggle -- Audrey points her gun at Drew but doesn’t shoot as Drew pulls the gun from her by the barre  111. Then BAM. She SHOOTS. There’s a big bloody GAPING HOLE in hand. She stands and aims at the now fallen Drew.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Bitch! You blew my fucking hand off! Morgan runs to Audrey from the ship as Drew continues wai

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Jesus, how are you still alive?

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: Fuck you. I never liked you.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Feeling’s mutual, dick.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (to Drew) She tried to tell me you were full of shit. Should’ve listened. SIREN LIGHTS flash from right outside. The COPS are comin Sounds of COMMOTION as POLICE descend on the building. Au stays still and strong, gun steady, trained on Drew.

dialogues.speaker: DREW
dialogues.text: You're running out of time. Kill me. That’s what I would do.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: I’m sure it is. But I’m a better person than you. You revealed your true self. This is mine. The GERMAN POLICE burst in! Audrey calmly puts the gun do and nods to them. Take him. As the Polizei circle Drew, t try to cuff him but can only manage his non-destroyed han

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: To quote a text message I got once: “Hey there -- it’s over. Sorry.” Another OFFICER HELPS SEBASTIAN TO HIS FEET. He’s okay -- was wearing a BULLET PROOF VEST. Audrey rushes up.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What?! I didn’t know you had bullet- proof vests!

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: I just had the one.  112.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You know, I would’ve felt a little more comfortable if I also had a bullet-proof vest. So much for you protecting me.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: You protected yourself. Audrey smiles. He’s right, on a number of levels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chaos. The place is SURROUNDED by POLICE CARS. The POLIZE haul Drew into one just as Sebastian and Audrey step outs

dialogues.speaker: SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: Ambassador? Ma’am? Do you need an ambulance?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (demure, Canadian) Oh no. We're fine, thanks. We just have to leave... emergency back home... our hockey team is sick. Morgan runs out after them. As she passes the guard:

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Cirque de Soleil is also from Canada. So I know them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our heroes walk down the gorgeous riverside BIKE PATH, aw from the FUCKING CHAOS behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Sebastian... can I see your phone? He hands it over. Morgan dials as they walk.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mom! Get Dad! Yeah, I know, I’m calling from this international spy’s phone... Sebastian Henshaw.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Can you not reveal my identity?

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: She tells them everything. She’s not allowed to lie.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Now I don’t have to. (beat) (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Guess what, guys?! I just went to a museum. BEEP. Call waiting.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Ugh. Hang on a second.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wendy sits at her desk, on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: WENDY
dialogues.text: Nice job, Henshaw. We found the correspondence between Thayer, Patel and Highland... I’m sorry I questioned your loyalty. Behind her, Wendy’s ADORABLE SON (6) hands her a cute dra WENDY (CONT’D) What’s this supposed to be? A dog? A cat? It looks like a piece of shit. (then, into phone) Destroy that drive. Then come in.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: I'll give him the message. I’m just kinda on the other line right now. Morgan hangs up on Wendy. Wendy stares at the phone. That a first. Morgan Sebastian.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: CIA lady said destroy the drive. (then, to her parents) Okay, and what did the Doctor say about your cholesterol? On Sebastian and Audrey --

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: So Drew didn’t get the drive.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: You said put it somewhere safe. (then) Morgan, give me the thing. Morgan, still on the phone, fishes the drive from her CLEAVAGE. Hands it to Audrey. Then Morgan notices a MAN coming her way, carrying flower EDWARD SNOWDEN.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: The fuck... I’11 call you back. (hanging up) Eddie... how’d you know I was here?

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: I know everything that has happened and everything that’s going to happen. (then, flirty) Want to know what’s gonna happen right now?

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: Uh, sure. Edward Snowden produces two THEATER TICKETS from his pock

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: You’re coming with me to see Guys and Dolls at the Admiralspalast. Then a bottle of ice-cold Riesling. And then maybe we can repeat what happened last time after we saw Guys and Dolls together at camp.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: ...Or another idea is we can just go see Guys and Dolls as friends.

dialogues.speaker: EDWARD SNOWDEN
dialogues.text: Should've known that was gonna happen. BACK ON AUDREY and SEBASTIAN. Staring at the drive.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: You can do the honors. Audrey smiles. Then SNAPS THE DRIVE IN HALF. She hurls th pieces OFF THE BRIDGE.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Can’t they just make another one?

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: It’s their software. They can make these whenever they want. That’s where the world is headed anyway. Total transparency. Everyone wants to know everything.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: (shrugging) I still think it’s better to give people the chance to show you who they are. On their own terms.  115.

dialogues.speaker: SEBASTIAN
dialogues.text: Safe to say you’ve done that. A sweet, intimate silence... Then Audrey and Sebastian finally KISS. We leave them in peace, pulling out to the Berlin night...

dialogues.speaker: SIX MONTHS LATER
dialogues.text: INT. SILVER LAKE TRADER JOE’S - DAY Audrey's back at the register, still with her BLOND HAIR. there’s another big difference: she looks HAPPY to be her she rings up a customer. The next customer steps up... TE

dialogues.speaker: TESS
dialogues.text: Oh my God, Audrey! Your blond hair is so fun! (then, pitying) I didn’t know you still worked here.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY
dialogues.text: Hey Tess! Yeah, you know, I realized this job is actually perfect for me. It’s easy, it’s not too stressful, I can save my energy for my real passions. And you can’t beat the flexibility. Tess is taken aback. Audrey’s CELL BUZZES with a TEXT.

dialogues.speaker: AUDREY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Speaking of which, they need me in the supply room! God I love when I have to get supplies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Audrey works quickly -- stealthily removes a CINDER BLOCK from the wall -- pulls out a FAKE PASSPORT, FOREIGN MONEY etc. As skilled as Drew was at this. EXT. TRADER JOE’S PARKING LOT - DAY Audrey moves fast toward the corner of the lot where the BLACK VAN she was interrogated in is parked. This time, Audrey confidently slides the door open and dives in with hesitation. The van glides away.  116.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The unmistakable neon hub of Tokyo’s popular nightlife ar As we move to a side street, push into a dark BASEMENT CL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dimly lit except for garish flashing neon lights. We foll AUDREY -- now in a stunning GOLD COCKTAIL DRESS -- as she confidently winds through a packed, intoxicated crowd. Approaches an expressionless CLERK at a HOST STAND.

dialogues.speaker: CLERK
dialogues.text: (Japanese) Reservation? Audrey's about to give her name when the sound of GLASS SHATTERING cuts the air. The clerk -- and everyone else - turns, distracted by the DRUNK COUPLE who just knocked ov huge stack of glasses... It’s MORGAN. With a Japanese BUSINESSMAN. Making a huge scene. Seemingly oblivious to Audrey.

dialogues.speaker: MORGAN
dialogues.text: (to the Businessman) Oh my God Akira you’re a mess! (to the bartenders) Barkeep! Two more Yakuzas please! Or wait, whatever this whiskey is called. Yakuza is the thing you’re in, right? Oh wait, shit, was that a secret? Unattended now, Audrey subtly REACHES BEHIND THE HOST STA and presses a button. A DOOR behind the stand clicks. Unlocked. Audrey heads for it, when--

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (0.S.)
